Potential solution here? <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/issues/4834>#4834</denchmark-link> looks like they are reving versions?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/jiuntian>@jiuntian</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-code>ustomresourcedefinition.apiextensions.k8s.io/adapters.config.istio.io unchanged customresourcedefinition.apiextensions.k8s.io/apikeys.config.istio.io unchanged customresourcedefinition.apiextensions.k8s.io/attributemanifests.config.istio.io unchanged customresourcedefinition.apiextensions.k8s.io/authorizations.config.istio.io unchanged customresourcedefinition.apiextensions.k8s.io/bypasses.config.istio.io unchanged customresourcedefinition.apiextensions.k8s.io/certificates.certmanager.k8s.io unchanged </denchmark-code>
Seems you already have istio installed, could you run kfctl delete -V -f manifest and try again? If you can not delete them successfully, you can delete istio-namespace

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/jiuntian>@jiuntian</denchmark-link> it's not related. You failed to install istio, this is separate. Could you show me the cluster status before you start over? you have to make sure everything is cleaned up and then start from scratch, feel free to share full logs.

Some cluster status here: kubectl get componentstatus <denchmark-code>NAME STATUS MESSAGE ERROR scheduler Healthy ok controller-manager Healthy ok etcd-0 Healthy {"health":"true"} </denchmark-code>
kubectl cluster-info <denchmark-code>Kubernetes master is running at https://C1494B6848E89415CE60651DD489BA82.gr7.us-east-1.eks.amazonaws.com CoreDNS is running at https://C1494B6848E89415CE60651DD489BA82.gr7.us-east-1.eks.amazonaws.com/api/v1/namespaces/kube-system/services/kube-dns:dns/proxy </denchmark-code>
Do let me know if need other detail information. Thanks
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/jiuntian>@jiuntian</denchmark-link> could you run ?

<denchmark-code>NAME STATUS AGE codefresh-runtime Active 160d default Active 161d istio-system Active 2d5h k6 Active 160d kube-node-lease Active 74d kube-public Active 161d kube-system Active 161d kubeflow Active 2d5h monitoring Active 158d </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/jiuntian>@jiuntian</denchmark-link> As I said, could you run and make sure , namespace are deleted before you run

I got this message when trying to delete with kfctl delete -V -f manifest.yaml <denchmark-code>couldn't delete KfApp: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: kfApp Delete failed for kustomize: (kubeflow.error): Code 400 with message: cannot find ClusterName within KfDef, this may cause error deletion to clusters. </denchmark-code>
So, I try to delete the namespaces by kubectl delete ns istio-system and kubectl delete ns kubeflow I run kubectl get ns again, i got <denchmark-code>kubectl get ns NAME STATUS AGE codefresh-runtime Active 161d default Active 162d k6 Active 161d kube-node-lease Active 75d kube-public Active 162d kube-system Active 162d monitoring Active 159d </denchmark-code>
After these two namespaces deleted, I guess the installation should be clean completely, I try again the installation, with kfctl apply -V -f manifest.yaml Then, I got the same error again.

You still have CRDs in the cluster. Do you mind clean up istio crds as well? kfctl tried to find ClusterName and seems it meet some problems here. If you still meet problem on this, you can try to add it manually and rerun the command <denchmark-code>apiVersion: kfdef.apps.kubeflow.org/v1 kind: KfDef metadata: annotations: kfctl.kubeflow.io/force-delete: "false" clusterName: kf12.us-west-2.eksctl.io // -> add this creationTimestamp: null name: kf12 namespace: kubeflow
</denchmark-code>
To get clusterName, you can run kubectl config get-contexts and find it.

Thanks, after adding clusterName, I can now delete it with kfctl delete -V -f manifest.yaml, so everything was deleted. Then, I have tried kfctl apply -V -f manifest.yaml again, But I still stuck on the same place.. Do you need any other logs?

Could you check your CRDs after you delete and before you apply? Is the error message exact same as the logs you attached here? I would suggest you to attach more error logs and result you kubectl get ns and kubectl get crds

After I delete: kubectl get ns <denchmark-code>NAME STATUS AGE codefresh-runtime Active 162d default Active 163d k6 Active 161d kube-node-lease Active 76d kube-public Active 163d kube-system Active 163d monitoring Active 159d </denchmark-code>
kubectl get crds <denchmark-code>NAME CREATED AT alertmanagers.monitoring.coreos.com 2020-02-24T03:30:57Z eniconfigs.crd.k8s.amazonaws.com 2019-11-20T09:26:46Z podmonitors.monitoring.coreos.com 2020-02-24T03:30:57Z prometheuses.monitoring.coreos.com 2020-02-24T03:30:57Z prometheusrules.monitoring.coreos.com 2020-02-24T03:30:58Z servicemonitors.monitoring.coreos.com 2020-02-24T03:30:58Z </denchmark-code>
Yes, the error message is exact the same as the log attached.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/jiuntian>@jiuntian</denchmark-link> Could you attach logs again? It won't be same because in your original logs, it said crd is unchanged, if you clean up crd, it should show something different. BTW, we just release 1.0.1, I would suggest to try that as well <denchmark-code>INFO[0006] Deploying application istio-crds filename="kustomize/kustomize.go:172" customresourcedefinition.apiextensions.k8s.io/adapters.config.istio.io unchanged customresourcedefinition.apiextensions.k8s.io/apikeys.config.istio.io unchanged customresourcedefinition.apiextensions.k8s.io/attributemanifests.config.istio.io unc
